exceptions.exn: Wrong bullet +: Current bullet + is not finished.
Wrong bullet -: Current bullet + is not finished.
In environment T : poset s1, s2 : chain T H : s1 =p s2 Unable to unify "s2" with "s1".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: poset
s2: chain T
s1: chain T

Goal:
s1 = s2 <-> s1 =p s2

Premises:
Record chain (T : poset) : Type := Chain { pred_of : Pred T; _ : chain_axiom pred_of } Arguments Chain [T pred_of]
Notation poset := Poset.type
supE : forall (T : lattice) (s1 s2 : Pred T), s1 =p s2 -> sup s1 = sup s2
Mem_map_inv : ?x \In [seq ?f i | i <- ?s] -> exists y : ?T, ?x = ?f y /\ y \In ?s where ?T : [T : poset s1 : chain T s2 : chain T |- Type] ?T' : [T : poset s1 : chain T s2 : chain T |- Type] ?f : [T : poset s1 : chain T s2 : chain T |- ?T -> ?T'] ?x : [T : poset s1 : chain T s2 : chain T |- ?T'] ?s : [T : poset s1 : chain T s2 : chain T |- seq ?T]
Mem_cat : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s1 s2 : seq T), x \In s1 ++ s2 < -> x \In s1 \/ x \In s2
app_mono : forall x : ?A, monotone (@^~ x) where ?A : [T : poset s1 : chain T s2 : chain T |- Type] ?T : [T : poset s1 : chain T s2 : chain T |- poset]
dapp_mono : forall x : ?A, monotone (@^~ x) where ?A : [T : poset s1 : chain T s2 : chain T |- Type] ?T : [T : poset s1 : chain T s2 : chain T |- ?A -> poset]
sup_mono : forall (T : lattice) (s1 s2 : Pred T), s1 <=p s2 -> sup s1 <== sup s2
sup_clos_mono : forall (T : lattice) (s1 s2 : Pred T), s1 <=p s2 -> sup_closure s1 <=p sup_closure s2
In_split : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s : seq_PredType T), x \In s -> exists s1 s2 : seq T, s = s1 ++ x :: s2
cat = fun T : Type => fix cat (s1 s2 : seq T) {struct s1} : seq T := match s1 with | [::] => s2 | x :: s1' => x :: cat s1' s2 end : forall T : Type, seq T -> seq T -> seq T Arguments cat {T}%type_scope (_ _)%seq_scope
pred_of : forall T : poset, chain T -> Pred T
Chain : forall (T : poset) (pred_of : Pred T), chain_axiom pred_of -> chain T
BinInt.Z.eqb_eq : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.eqb n m = true < -> n = m
BinPos.Pos.sub_mask_nul_iff : forall p q : BinNums.positive, BinPos.Pos.sub_mask p q = BinPos.Pos.IsNul < -> p = q
BinPos.Pos.compare_eq_iff : forall p q : BinNums.positive, BinPos.Pos.compare p q = Eq < -> p = q
Image_inj_eqmem : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (X1 X2 : Pred A), injective f -> [Image f i | i <- X1] =p [Image f i | i <- X2] -> X1 =p X2
ZMicromega.isZ0_n0 : forall x : BinNums.Z, ZMicromega.isZ0 x = false < -> x <> BinNums.Z0
Reflect.Z_eqb_eq : forall a b : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.eqb a b < -> a = b
PeanoNat.Nat.pow_eq_0_iff : forall a b : nat, PeanoNat.Nat.pow a b = 0 < -> b <> 0 /\ a = 0
sup_clos_idemp : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T), sup_closed s -> sup_closure s =p s
BinPos.Pos.max_r_iff : forall n m : BinNums.positive, BinPos.Pos.max n m = m < -> BinPos.Pos.le n m
Mem_Seq1 : forall (T : Type) (x y : T), x \In [:: y] < -> x = y
Mem_morhp : forall (T : Type) (pT : PredType T) (x y : pT), x <~> y -> x =p y
subp_asym : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 : Pred T), p1 <=p p2 -> p2 <=p p1 -> p1 =p p2
InE : forall T : Type, (forall x y : T, x \In [:: y] <-> x = y) * (forall (y : T) (s : seq T) (x : T), x \In y :: s <-> x = y \/ x \In s) * (forall (T0 : Type) (x : T0) (p : Simpl_Pred T0), (x \In p) = p x)
orpF : forall p : Prop, p \/ False < -> p
In_cons : forall (T : Type) (y : T) (s : seq T) (x : T), x \In y :: s < -> x = y \/ x \In s
In_nil : forall (T : Type) (x : T), x \In [::] < -> False
iffRL : forall P Q : Prop, P < -> Q -> Q -> P
iffLR : forall P Q : Prop, P < -> Q -> P -> Q
InMem_morph : forall (T : Type) (x y : T), x = y -> forall x0 y0 : Mem_Pred T, EqMem x0 y0 -> InMem x x0 < -> InMem y y0
iffLRn : forall P Q : Prop, P < -> Q -> ~ P -> ~ Q
iffRLn : forall P Q : Prop, P < -> Q -> ~ Q -> ~ P
ImageEq : forall (A B : Type) (f1 f2 : A -> B) (X : Pred A), f1 =1 f2 -> [Image f1 i | i <- X] =p [Image f2 i | i <- X]
orrAb : forall (T : Type) (r1 a : Pred T), r1 <~> PredU r1 a < -> a ~> r1
ImageU : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (X1 X2 : Pred A), [Image f i | i <- PredU X1 X2] =p [PredU [Image f i | i <- X1] & [Image f i | i <- X2]]
ImageIm : forall (A B C : Type) (f1 : B -> C) (f2 : A -> B) (X : Pred A), [Image f1 i | i <- [Image f2 i | i <- X]] =p [Image (f1 \o f2) i | i <- X]
subp_or : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 q : Pred T), p1 <=p q /\ p2 <=p q < -> PredU p1 p2 <=p q
subp_and : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 q : Pred T), q <=p p1 /\ q <=p p2 < -> q <=p (fun x : T => p1 x /\ p2 x)
PeanoNat.Nat.eq_equiv = RelationClasses.eq_equivalence : RelationClasses.Equivalence eq
BinPos.Pos.lt = fun x y : BinNums.positive => BinPos.Pos.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> Prop Arguments BinPos.Pos.lt (_ _)%positive_scope

```  
split.  
- intros H. apply mem_seq_eq. split.  
  + apply chain_is_seq.  
  + apply chain_is_seq.  
- intros H. apply chain_extensionality. apply mem_seq_eq. split.  
  + apply seq_is_chain.  
  + apply seq_is_chain.  
Qed.  
```
